title: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra 12 Nights 13 Days
description: Embark on the sacred journey to Mount Kailash and Lake Mansarovar, one of the most revered pilgrimage sites in Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, and Bon religion. This 13-day overland journey from Kathmandu offers a transformative spiritual experience through the mystical landscapes of Tibet.
highlights: Holy bath and prayers at Lake Mansarovar
Spiritual journey through pristine Tibetan landscapes
Cultural immersion in Tibetan Buddhist traditions
Gamow bag for altitude sickness prevention
inclusions: Gamow bag for altitude sickness prevention
First aid kit and medical support
exclusions: Personal medical kit and Diamox tablets

itinerary.title: Arrival in Kathmandu (1300m)
itinerary.description: Upon arrival at Kathmandu International Airport, you will be greeted and assisted by our representative after completing custom formalities. Transfer to hotel for check-in. Evening yatra briefing session before dinner covering important aspects of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra.
itinerary.accommodation: Hotel Mandala Norling Lord Prime (Twin Sharing)

itinerary.title: Kathmandu Temple Visit
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on Kathmandu city sightseeing tour. Visit Pashupatinath Temple, Boudhanath Stupa (World Heritage Site), Jal Narayan Temple (Sleeping Vishnu), and Kathmandu Durbar Square (Living God Kumari). Return to hotel for packing and preparation for the yatra.
itinerary.accommodation: Hotel Mandala Norling Lord Prime (Twin Sharing)

itinerary.title: Kathmandu to Kodari (1600m)
itinerary.description: Drive to Kodari (145 km, 5-6 hours) at the Nepal-Tibet border. Complete immigration formalities and prepare for entry into Tibet. Overnight at Kodari.

itinerary.title: Kodari to Nylam (2800m)
itinerary.description: Cross into Tibet and drive to Nylam (160 km, 4-5 hours) for acclimatization. This is an important day for altitude adjustment as we gain significant elevation.

itinerary.title: Nylam to Saga (4500m)
itinerary.description: Drive to Saga (270 km, 6-7 hours) crossing the mighty Brahmaputra River. The journey takes you through stunning Tibetan landscapes and high-altitude terrain.

itinerary.title: Saga to Mansarovar (4550m)
itinerary.description: Drive to the sacred Lake Mansarovar (470 km, 8-9 hours). Upon arrival, check-in at Pramath Ashram. First glimpse of the holy lake and preparation for tomorrow's parikrama.

itinerary.title: Mansarovar Parikrama to Darchen (4600m)
itinerary.description: Complete Mansarovar Parikrama by vehicle (102 km, 3 hours). Take holy bath in the sacred lake, perform puja and homa ceremonies. Continue drive to Darchen (58 km, 1.5 hours), the base camp for Kailash Parikrama.

itinerary.title: Darchen to Diraphuk (4860m)
itinerary.description: Begin the sacred Kailash Parikrama. Visit Yamdwar for darshan, then trek to Diraphuk (12 km, 4-5 hours). First day of the challenging but spiritually rewarding circumambulation of Mount Kailash.

itinerary.title: Diraphuk to Zutulphuk via Dolma La Pass (4650m)
itinerary.description: The most challenging day of the yatra. Cross the Dolma La Pass at 5,630m, the highest point of the parikrama. Trek to Zutulphuk (22 km, 8-10 hours). This is considered the most spiritually significant day of the journey.

itinerary.title: Zutulphuk to Darchen to Saga (4500m)
itinerary.description: Complete the Kailash Parikrama by trekking back to Darchen (8 km, 2-3 hours). After completing this sacred journey, drive back to Saga for overnight rest.

itinerary.title: Saga to Nylam (2800m)
itinerary.description: Drive back to Nylam (270 km, 6-7 hours) retracing the route through the beautiful Tibetan landscapes. Gradual descent to lower altitude for better rest.

itinerary.title: Nylam to Kathmandu (1300m)
itinerary.description: Cross back into Nepal and drive to Kathmandu (160 km + 145 km, 8-9 hours total). Return to the familiar environment and comfortable accommodation for rest and relaxation.
itinerary.accommodation: Hotel Mandala Norling Lord Prime (Twin Sharing)

itinerary.title: Departure from Kathmandu
itinerary.description: Transfer to Tribhuvan International Airport for departure or extend your stay in Kathmandu for additional sightseeing and shopping.

booking_info.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 7 days before departure

important_notes.health_requirements: Medical examination recommended before travel. Participants should be examined by a doctor to assess health condition and ability to cope with high altitude travel, extreme cold, dust, and trekking to 19,500ft during parikrama.
important_notes.altitude_sickness: Travelers are likely to experience altitude sickness symptoms (headache, loss of appetite, nausea, exhaustion, sleeplessness, breathlessness) until body adjusts. Mandatory 2 nights stay at Mansarovar (4550m) for acclimatization. Diamox tablets recommended. Gamow bag provided for altitude sickness prevention.
important_notes.currency: Chinese Yuan is the local currency. USD 1 = 7.02 Yuan & 1 Yuan = INR 11.90 approx. Money can be exchanged at Bank of China at Kyirung county.
what_to_bring: Thermal underwear, warm trousers & woolen shirts
Warm sweaters, woolen gloves, sun hat
Strong water bottle & water purifying tablets
Personal medical kit and Diamox tablets
Wet tissues and personal hygiene items
important_notes.risks_liability: All tours in Tibet are conducted under Tibet Tourism Bureau (TTB) rules and regulations. Company shall not be responsible for changes due to unavoidable circumstances such as landslide, road blockage, flood, snow, political unrest, flight cancellation, delays, sickness or accidents. Extra costs shall be borne by clients.
